title: Understanding Workbook Merging
text: When merging workbooks, it's crucial to ensure that all workbooks are derived from the same original workbook. This ensures consistency and compatibility during the merging process.

title: Why Copies Matter
text: If workbooks are not copies of the same original workbook, there might be discrepancies in data structure, leading to errors or data loss during merging.

title: Confirming the Statement
text: Based on the information provided, is it true that for workbook changes to be merged, all workbooks must be a copy of the same workbook?
